text:
Hey everyone,

Just following up on my previous post regarding the issue with tracking Google and Facebook leads after the recent API shift. We haven't received any feedback yet and would really appreciate your insights or suggestions on how to resolve this. Has anyone else faced similar issues or found a workaround?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Hello everyone :wave:,
I’m using HubSpot to perform operations with my NestJS app, and I’m having trouble with a particular method.
It turns out that the client wants an email to be sent with a Welcome message when a new deal is created, using a template that is already set up in the UI.
To do this, I first need to get the list of email templates that are already created. After looking through the documentation and the beta-docs, I found that it’s possible to make a GET request to `<http://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/templates>`. The response returns the following:
```{
    "limit": 100,
    "objects": [],
    "offset": 0,
    "total": 0
}```
I expected it to return an array with all the available templates. Could someone tell me if I’m missing something or if I’m doing anything wrong?
I’ve seen this issue raised twice: once in the HubSpot forum and the other time in this channel, but I haven’t seen a response yet. Thank you very much.

Hi all anyone used nitropack for HubSpot
<https://docs.getnitropack.com/>
I'm implementing OAuth - is there a HubSpot API endpoint to get information about the currently authenticated user?
<@U032R35S3A9> im not entirely sure what API do you mean ? Any relevant links ?

:wave: Hello, team!
I have alert
```Your COMPANY_TO_EMAIL association has a maximum limit of 50000 associated EMAIL records per COMPANY.
The following COMPANY objects have reached 80% usage of COMPANY_TO_EMAIL associations```
to fix this, I used `/engagements/v1/engagements/paged` API and filtered type=Email and saved associations, but it found 60 associations
next, I used `/crm-associations/v1/associations/{$objectId}/HubSpot_DEFINED/{$definitionId}`, where objectId is company id from alert, and definitionId is 2, but it returned less than 1000 records.

Is there solution to fix this alert?
